name: ancient_egypt_akhenaten_reforms_1340bc
context: A structured interview protocol designed to gauge the hidden sentiments of Egyptian citizens during the reign of Pharaoh Akhenaten (c. 1353–1336 BC). The survey context captures a moment of radical theological upheaval, where the traditional pantheon of gods (especially Amun) has been proscribed in favor of the sole worship of the sun-disk, the Aten. This instrument seeks to measure the tension between public compliance with the Pharaoh's decrees and private adherence to ancestral traditions, as well as perceptions of the new capital, Akhetaten.

questions.preprompt: In the quiet of {player_name}'s own home, away from the eyes of the Pharaoh's guards, how would {player_name} respond to the following statement?
questions.statement: The old temples of Amun, now closed and silent, still hold the true power of Egypt.

questions.preprompt: Reflecting on the rituals of their ancestors, to what extent does {player_name} agree with this sentiment?
questions.statement: It is foolish to pray to statues of Osiris or Thoth when the living sun is right above us.

questions.preprompt: Consider {player_name}'s deepest spiritual needs. How much does {player_name} agree?
questions.statement: Without the many gods to guide the dead through the Duat, {player_name}'s soul will be lost forever.

questions.preprompt: Thinking about the hidden shrines some still keep, how does {player_name} feel about this statement?
questions.statement: {player_name} secretly makes offerings to the hidden gods to ensure the harvest is bountiful.

questions.preprompt: Gazing up at the sun-disk during the midday heat, how strongly does {player_name} agree with the new teachings?
questions.statement: The Aten is the sole creator of life, and no other divinity exists beside It.

questions.preprompt: Considering the new capital city of Akhetaten, how does {player_name} view the changes?
questions.statement: The worship of the sun-disk feels cold and distant compared to the warmth of the old festivals.

questions.preprompt: When hearing the Great Hymn to the Aten recited, what is {player_name}'s reaction?
questions.statement: {player_name} feels a genuine spiritual awakening when contemplating the light of the Aten.

questions.preprompt: Regarding the Pharaoh's vision for Egypt, to what extent does {player_name} agree?
questions.statement: Akhenaten is the living spirit of the Aten on earth, and his word is divine law.

questions.preprompt: Thinking about the rapid construction of the new city and the taxes required, how does {player_name} feel?
questions.statement: The Pharaoh's obsession with his new capital is leading Egypt to ruin and neglect.

questions.preprompt: Considering the banishment of the priests of Amun, does {player_name} support the Pharaoh's decision?
questions.statement: {player_name} trusts that the Pharaoh knows what is best for the spiritual health of the kingdom.

questions.preprompt: When discussing the royal family with neighbors, how guarded is {player_name}?
questions.statement: {player_name} believes the Pharaoh has abandoned the protection of Egypt's borders to focus on his poetry.
